title_sort: letter from walt whitman to vinnie ream, 17 july [1871?]
title: Letter from Walt Whitman to Vinnie Ream, 17 July [1871?]
text: MondayafternoonJuly 17. In 1871 Walt Whitman took his "vacation considerably earlier than usual," according to his April 21, 1871, letter to Abby H. Price. Vinnie Ream, Vinnie Ream (1847–1914) made a bust from life of Abraham Lincoln, who agreed to sit weekly for the young sculptor. After his assassination she was commissioned to do a statue for the rotunda in the Capitol. When the work was unveiled in 1871, there was some criticism of the first woman to execute such a commission. Reproductions of her sculpture, as well as a portrait by George Caleb Bingham and a bust by Clark MIlls, appear in Antiques (November 1976), 1016–1018. My dear friend,I would like to call on you, with an acquaintance of mine, John Swinton, John Swinton (1829–1901), a journalist and friend of Karl Marx, became acquainted with Walt Whitman during the Civil War; Whitman's correspondence with Swinton began on February 23, 1863. at about 11 A. M. to morrow, Tuesday.Walt Whitman Letter from Walt Whitman to Vinnie Ream, 17 July [1871?]
